intro: Stereospermum variabile, commonly known as the variable star vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive foliage and floral display.
